name: Holiday Inn Club Vacations Orlando - Orange Lake Resort

reviews.text: We returned for a two week visit to OL after having a great experience in 2006 and brought another family with us this time. We recieved 2BDR accommodations in the North Village as requested. This area is central to the resort and easy to come and go from the Publix side.
reviews.title: Excellent Family Vacation

likes.liked: — Large apartment units and numerous pool areas
likes.disliked: — high cost of renting tubes, boat rides etc.

reviews.title: Loved Orange Lake!!!
reviews.text: Check in and out was quick and hassle free. We recieved a couple of calls from RCI representatives and were left alone after declining offers for time share tours.

The units were clean, well equipped and very functional for a family of 4. We recieved a complimentary cleaning after the first week which was great. This type of resort appeals to active people who like variety. Each of the major swimming areas has something different to offer. The West Village pool area has been nicely redone with poolside shops and bars. Our kids loved switching from Splash Lagoon to West Village to River Island, shooting hoops and playing shuffle board. Chairs were always available. Publix was very convenient for groceries and combo meals. Walmart is also close by.
reviews.title: Nice stay, make sure you......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OL is about 15 min away from the Disney parks and outlets. We spent 7 days between the 4 theme parks and 2 water parks. Every second day was spent at OL recovering from a full day at Disney. Cocoa beach is about 1 h 15 min drive and is certainly worth a day trip. The beach is great and was a nice change. There are lots of parking areas and it was very easy to get to.
reviews.title: Close to Disney

reviews.text: Overall I would rate our experience 5*. Sure there were some pet peeves like having to pay for tubes and hippo rides but the resort has so much to offer a family who love the outdoors, these things are easy to over look. It's vast in size and somewhat impersonal. We never saw the same people twice.
reviews.title: Our kids had a wonderful time at Orange Lake!!!

likes.liked: — Resort is clean, Nice landscaping, Pools
likes.disliked: — noise by workers and golfers early in the morning

reviews.text: My mother has a timeshare here and she very generously let my friend and i use it this year.
reviews.title: Lovely place!! don't be afraid to complain!!

likes.liked: — the accomadation is superb, the facilities are brilliant - always something to do

reviews.text: i have been many times in the last 14 years and have seen the place grow immensly.
reviews.title: A Wonderful and Relaxing Getaway!

likes.liked: — Relaxing, Swimming in nearby pool as well as Water Park, Clean, Spacious Rooms! LAUNDRY MACHINES!!!!!!
likes.disliked: — We needed to hop in the car to get to around!

reviews.text: pros: the accommodation is excellent, the facilities are second to none i could live there all year round.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay!

likes.disliked: — Slow service in the River Island Grilling company

reviews.text: cons: overcharging!!! 2 dollars for a can of coke!! nearly 3 dollars for a small bottle of water!! 8 dollars for a vodka and orange!! unbelievable to say the least.
reviews.title: Too big, pricey ammenities, noisy and smelly
Loved the West Village
reviews.text: i would also watch out for the "phone cards" which you buy in the onsite store. the cards quoted international phone calls for only 5c a minute but if you use the villa phone you will be charged an extra 1 dollar 5c per call regardless of if the call connected. i was unaware of this until i went to check out and the "economical phone card" (which cost 10 dollars) led to them trying to charge me nearly 70 dollars for connection costs!! now don't get me wrong i am not tight and i will pay for a service if i deem i got good value for money but this is outrageous so i argued with them. to cut a long story short in order for them to get rid of me they agreed to cut the cost of the calls to only 27 dollars - don't be afraid to argue your case. i can imagine a lot of people paying up and leaving very unhappy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I vacationed at Orange Lake while they were undergoing renovations so our experience was affected by this (which we know was expected). Although, Certain things did happened during our stay that could have been avoided by the resort. For starters we were double booked with another couple in the same unit which led to an awkward encounter when they just popped into the unit that we just began unpacking in. Because of this Orange Lake ended up giving the other couple a different room but in the process they made it so the room keys didn't access that unit, including ours. My girlfriend and I went food shopping after we unpacked (not realizing our room keys didn't work) and came back to our unit not being able to enter it. It took the maintenance team a good 45-60 minutes to get this problem straightened out while our frozen groceries sat in the hallway defrosting. The resort redeemed me for certain things that shouldn't be refrozen which was nice of them to do although they caused the trouble in the first place, some places may not have given us anything.
reviews.title: This place has seen better days

likes.liked: — The rooms are spacious, the pools are nice (river island is a lot of fun), Restaurants on premises are nice
likes.disliked: — overcrowded, staff seemed oblivious at times

reviews.text: Because renovations were taking place one of their pools was closed making the other pools overcrowded. This was annoying as people were claiming pool chairs hours before coming to the pool. Before realizing this was going on, we literally walked around the pool for 20-30 minutes looking for two vacant pool chairs but after we realized what people were doing we had no problem moving their towels and just taking the seats. Now that all the pools are open I would hope this isn't still going on.
reviews.title: Robbed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would come back to Orange Lake in the future but not for a while... I used to really love this place but it seems like it went from a fun family resort to a typical timeshare resort ever since its creator/founder Kemmons Wilson passed away in 2003. I think his kids took it over and as always things change when the kids take over.
reviews.title: Really Great place to stay

likes.liked: — All - it is really a great place.
likes.disliked: — We have to pay for the Internet WI-FI.

reviews.text: Checked in on Sunday Aug 3 2008 stayed in room 86741 room was nice and clean (3 bedroom) Everything seemed to work ok. On Tuesday Aug 5 we went to River Island for the day it was very nice. When we got back to our room we found that some one had been in our room a breathing machine (cpap) was taken off the night stand in the master bedroom and also are Disney tickets were taken off the same night stand, we called security and they came up and did a lock review with a computer in the key slot on the door, they told us that while we were gone some one from house keeping was in our room, at that point they told us they would check with house keeping and get back with us. About one hour later they came back to the room withthe breathing machine saying the person took it by mistake, I asked if they took the Disney tickets by mistake also, They told me the only way they could help me with the tickets is if I had the reciept for them. I tried to explan to them the we come to Orlando a couple times a year and we had our tickets from a visit in May an I did not have the reciept, I also told them that I stayed at OL in May. They told me they would get back to us in 24/48 hours. Today is Aug 11 and I am home now and still no word from OL.
reviews.title: I've never been disturbed more times by hotel staff!

likes.liked: — The rooms unit was spacious and comfortable.
likes.disliked: — The air conditioner was broken and the sales staff constantly marketing their units by phone to guests at all hours of the day and night.

reviews.text: iF YOU STAY HERE LOCK AWAY ANY THING OF VALUE THE EMPLOYEES AT OL WILL COME IN YOUR ROOM AND ROBB YOU.
reviews.title: Steer clear of older apartments

likes.disliked: — Where to start... See my review

reviews.text: Well to say it was misleading is an understatement. We are a common family of 6 that made the best of it anyways. "Wi Fi" is available in the "common area" only. If you want it in the room you better get ready to plug into the data port on the side of the phone in your room and good luck with that.
reviews.title: Misleading to say the least!

likes.liked: — Quality of room and lack of daily room maid service.

reviews.text: I travel quite a bit on business and am used to staying in hotels abroad. This place is trying but really lack on the amenities. A rusted-out overflow hole on the sinks in the bathroom is but one of the poor quality examples I care to list.
reviews.title: Family Friendly and Convenient

likes.liked: — Pools and activities for the kids, two-bedroom condo units.
likes.disliked: — There was outdated decor, etc., but nothing worth notice when you just need a place to land a family after Disney parks.

reviews.text: In the review labeled "One Word - Misleading" was exactly the same experience my family had to a "T". Except, the "time share seminar" was only described as a free breakfast where we would receive a tour of the resort describing all of the activities offered for our vacation and a $60 voucher to a resort restaurant for us to use. NOT.
reviews.title: One word - Misleading

reviews.text: Oh yeah, maid/room service, nope. You clean the room yourself. Not kidding. You wash your own towels. etc in a common are that has washing machines.
reviews.title: Nice Resort, No Need to Exaggerate

reviews.text: It was a MAJOR disappointment to the wife and me, but we made the best of it due to the kids enjoyed the pool and lazy river area.
reviews.title: Amenities Nice....Rooms outdated

description: Welcome to the Premiere Family Vacation Resort in Orlando The Holiday Inn Club Vacations Resort offers your family an unparalleled Florida vacation experience. Our Orange Lake Resort is next door to Walt Disney World Parks and Animal Kingdom.At our resort in Orlando you'll discover the wonders of a 12-acre Waterpark with a tropical lazy river 7 pools and an 80-acre lake with watersports. You can even watch your little ones dance in concert with a dancing fountain. Get a head start on the magic with your own personal Disney concierge at our Disney Planning Center that is also located in the lobby at check in. Our 1450-acre Orlando resort hotel offers each member of the family interactive activities like the Gatorland Alligator Show where you can meet a gator face-to-face 36 holes of fun at the West Village Putt-Putt Golf a bowling alley arcades and 54 holes of golf. Whats more we even provide a convenient shuttle to all our resorts activities. Orange Lake Resort provides a premiere Florida vacation at a hotel that is 100% smoke free. Our villas pamper you with the unexpected amenities like spa-inspired baths and fully equipped kitchens. Our deluxe Orlando resort provides a grocery shopping service nine restaurants and did we mention free parking and high-speed Internet access? Your perfect Florida vacation begins at Orange Lake Resort.
